conclusion: Light Source Position: Initially, the light source is positioned such that it casts shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Objects: There are four objects casting these shadows.
Object casting shadow A: A blue cylindrical object.
Object casting shadow B: A spherical object.
Object casting shadow C: A rectangular object.
Object casting shadow D: A rectangular object with multiple circular indentations.

premise: When the light source moves to the back left, the angle of the light rays changes.
conclusion: The shadows will shift to the right and forward because the light is now coming from the back left.

premise: When the light source moves to the back left, the angle of the light rays changes.
conclusion: The shadows may become larger because the light rays are now hitting the objects at a more oblique angle, elongating the shadows.

premise: When the light source moves to the back right, the angle of the light rays changes again.
conclusion: The shadows will shift to the left and forward because the light is now coming from the back right.

premise: When the light source moves to the back right, the angle of the light rays changes again.
conclusion: Similar to the back left scenario, the shadows may become larger due to the more oblique angle of the light rays.

premise: Cylindrical Object (Shadow A): The shadow will be elongated in the direction of the light source's movement.
conclusion: The shadow of the cylindrical object will be elongated.

premise: Spherical Object (Shadow B): The shadow will be more circular but may appear slightly elongated depending on the angle.
conclusion: The shadow of the spherical object may appear slightly elongated.

premise: Rectangular Objects (Shadows C and D): The shadows will be elongated in the direction of the light source's movement, with the longer side of the rectangle parallel to the direction of the light.
conclusion: The shadows of the rectangular objects will be elongated.

premise: Back Left Movement: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the right and forward.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift to the right and forward.

premise: Back Left Movement: Shadows may become larger due to the more oblique angle of the light rays.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D become larger.

premise: Back Right Movement: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the left and forward.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift to the left and forward.
